options.title: Know about a Disease
options.description: Get detailed information about diseases, their symptoms, prevention, medication, and vaccines.

data.name: Tuberculosis (TB)
data.description: TB is an airborne bacterial infection primarily affecting the lungs. It spreads through droplets from coughs or sneezes.

data.name: Diabetes
data.description: Chronic condition marked by high blood sugar due to inadequate insulin or resistance.

data.name: Cardiovascular Diseases
data.description: Group of disorders including heart attack and stroke due to blocked vessels or heart issues.

data.name: Malaria
data.description: Mosquito-borne infection causing fever and potentially fatal complications.

data.name: Dengue
data.description: Virus spread by Aedes mosquitoes; prevalent in rainy season.

data.name: Respiratory Infections
data.description: Infections like pneumonia, bronchitis, and COPD affecting the lungs.
data.vaccine: Flu, pneumonia, and DPT vaccines available

data.name: Gastrointestinal Infections
data.description: Diseases like cholera and gastroenteritis from poor water/food hygiene.

data.name: Cancer
data.description: Abnormal cell growth; common types include breast, lung, oral, cervical.

data.name: HIV/AIDS
data.description: Virus attacks immune system, gradually leading to immune failure.

data.name: Hepatitis B & C
data.description: Viral infection causing liver inflammation, transmitted via blood and body fluids.

data.name: Typhoid
data.description: Water- and food-borne bacterial illness causing fever and digestive issues.

data.name: Chikungunya
data.description: Mosquito-borne viral disease causing fever and severe joint pain.

data.name: Japanese Encephalitis
data.description: Mosquito-borne viral infection affecting the brain, mostly in rural India.

data.name: COVID-19
data.description: Viral respiratory illness by coronavirus; global pandemic since 2020.

data.name: Stroke
data.description: Blockage or bleeding in the brain affecting physical and mental functions.

data.name: Chronic Kidney Disease
data.description: Progressive loss of kidney function, leading to waste accumulation in the body.

data.name: Asthma
data.description: Chronic respiratory condition with airway constriction and inflammation.

data.name: COPD
data.description: Progressive lung disease, mainly caused by smoking/pollution (Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease).
data.vaccine: Flu and pneumonia vaccines may help prevent complications

data.name: Diarrheal Diseases
data.description: Mainly affect children, caused by contaminated water/food.

data.name: Measles
data.description: Highly contagious viral illness mostly in children.

data.name: Hypertension
data.description: Chronic elevated blood pressure leading to organ damage.

data.name: Oral Diseases (Dental Caries)
data.description: Cavity-forming bacteria affecting teeth, widespread among children/adults.

data.name: Chickenpox
data.description: Viral infection causing itchy blisters and fever.

data.name: Mumps
data.description: Viral disease causing painful swelling of salivary glands; mostly affects kids.

data.name: Rubella
data.description: Mild viral illness causing rash and fever; risk for pregnant women.

data.name: Polio
data.description: Viral disease affecting nervous system, can cause paralysis.

data.name: Influenza
data.description: Seasonal viral illness affecting the respiratory system.

data.name: Pneumonia
data.description: Infection of the lungs by bacteria/virus/fungi.

data.name: Alzheimer's Disease
data.description: Progressive brain disorder affecting memory, cognition.

data.name: Rabies
data.description: Deadly viral disease transmitted by animal bites, notably dogs.

data.name: Kala-azar (Leishmaniasis)
data.description: Parasitic infection spread by sandflies, causes fever and organ enlargement.

data.name: Filariasis
data.description: Mosquito-borne parasitic disease resulting in limb swelling.

data.name: Plague
data.description: Bacterial infection by Yersinia pestis, mainly from rodents.

data.name: Diphtheria
data.description: Bacterial respiratory disease affecting children/adolescents.

data.name: Meningitis
data.description: Inflammation of protective membranes of brain & spinal cord, viral or bacterial.

data.name: Hepatitis A and E
data.description: Viral infections, mainly food and water-borne, affecting the liver.

data.name: Hand, Foot and Mouth Disease
data.description: Viral (often Coxsackie A), mostly in young children.

data.name: Urinary Tract Infections (UTI)
data.description: Bacterial infections of urinary tract, especially women.

data.name: Otitis Media
data.description: Middle ear infection, common in children.

data.name: Leprosy (Hansen's Disease)
data.description: Chronic infection by Mycobacterium leprae, affecting skin/nerves.

data.name: Schistosomiasis
data.description: Parasitic worm infection via contaminated water.

data.name: Rotavirus Diarrhea
data.description: Viral childhood diarrhea, severe dehydration risk.

data.name: Tetanus
data.description: Bacterial infection from wounds by Clostridium tetani.

data.name: Hantavirus Fever
data.description: Rodent-borne viral disease, rare but severe.

data.name: Epstein-Barr Virus (EBV) Infection
data.description: Linked with mononucleosis and some cancers.

data.name: Syphilis
data.description: STD caused by Treponema pallidum bacteria.

data.name: Gonorrhea
data.description: STD causing genital/urinary tract infection.

data.name: Chlamydia
data.description: Common bacterial STD among youth.

data.name: Amoebiasis
data.description: Protozoal infection from contaminated food/water.

data.name: Giardiasis
data.description: Intestinal protozoal infection, causes diarrhea and malnutrition.

data.name: Sickle Cell Disease
data.description: Hereditary blood disorder common in tribal regions.

data.name: Thalassemia
data.description: Inherited blood disorder causing anemia.

data.name: Anemia (Iron deficiency/other)
data.description: Low red blood cells from diet, disease, or genetics.

data.name: Osteoporosis
data.description: Bone weakening leading to fracture risk.

data.name: Musculoskeletal Disorders (Arthritis)
data.description: Joint pain and swelling (osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis).

data.name: Depression
data.description: Common mental health disorder, increasing in urban areas.

data.name: Anxiety Disorders
data.description: Mental health disorders marked by excessive worry or fear.

data.name: Common Cold and Flu
data.description: Viral respiratory infections that primarily impact the nose, throat, and airways.
data.vaccine: Flu vaccine recommended for high-risk groups

data.name: Cholera
data.description: Acute diarrheal illness caused by Vibrio cholerae bacteria.
data.vaccine: Cholera vaccine recommended in endemic areas

data.name: Skin Infections
data.description: Infections and fungal problems common due to humidity, pollution, and sweat.
data.vaccine: Vaccine not usually required for common skin infections

data.name: Gastroenteritis
data.description: Infection of the stomach/intestines, usually viral or bacterial.
data.vaccine: Rotavirus vaccine for infants, polio vaccine for overall prevention

data.name: Bronchitis
data.description: Inflammation of bronchial tubes mainly caused by infections or irritants.

data.name: Rheumatic Heart Disease
data.description: Damage to heart valves from rheumatic fever (post-streptococcal infection).
prevention: Prompt antibiotic treatment for strep throat
data.vaccine: No vaccine; focus on strep throat prevention

data.name: Coronary Artery Disease
data.description: Narrowing of heart arteries due to plaque, leading to heart attacks.

data.name: Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES)
data.description: Multiple viral and bacterial infections causing sudden brain inflammation.
data.vaccine: JE and other vaccines per guidelines

data.name: Rhinitis
data.description: Inflammation of nasal mucous membrane, caused by allergies/infections.

data.name: Scabies
data.description: Contagious skin infestation by mites, causing severe itching.

data.name: Dysentery
data.description: Intestinal infection (bacterial/amoebic) causing bloody diarrhea.

data.name: Conjunctivitis
data.description: Infection/allergy of the eye lining, highly contagious.

data.name: Tonsillitis
data.description: Infection/inflammation of tonsils, mostly viral or bacterial.

data.name: Sinusitis
data.description: Inflammation/infection of sinuses, often after a cold or allergies.

data.name: Goiter (from Iodine Deficiency)
data.description: Thyroid gland swelling due to iodine deficiency.

data.name: Rickets
data.description: Defective bone development from vitamin D/calcium deficiency.

data.name: Scurvy
data.description: Nutritional deficiency of vitamin C.

data.name: Beriberi
data.description: Deficiency of vitamin B1 (thiamine), causing nerve and heart issues.

data.name: Pellagra
data.description: Results from vitamin B3 (niacin) deficiency.

data.name: Iron Deficiency Anemia
data.description: Low hemoglobin due to poor dietary iron, menstrual loss, or malabsorption.

data.name: Protein Energy Malnutrition
data.description: Malnutrition from insufficient protein/calorie intake.

options.title: Know Disease from Symptoms
options.description: Enter symptoms to identify possible diseases.

data.description: COVID-19 is a viral respiratory infection caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
data.vaccine: Yes, multiple vaccines available (Covaxin, Covishield, Pfizer, Moderna, etc.)
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor immediately if you experience breathing difficulty, persistent chest pain, or high fever.

data.description: Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause chronic liver disease.
data.vaccine: Yes, Hepatitis B vaccine is available and effective.
data.consult_doctor: Doctor consultation is essential as untreated hepatitis B can lead to liver cirrhosis or cancer.

data.description: Cholera is a bacterial infection of the intestines caused by Vibrio cholerae, leading to severe watery diarrhea.
data.vaccine: Yes, oral cholera vaccines are available.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if diarrhea is severe, persistent, or accompanied by dehydration.

data.description: Coronary artery disease occurs when plaque builds up in the coronary arteries, reducing blood flow to the heart.
data.consult_doctor: Doctor consultation is critical if you experience chest pain or symptoms of a heart attack.

data.description: Meningitis is an inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, usually due to infection.
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected persons
data.vaccine: Yes, vaccines against bacterial meningitis are available.
data.consult_doctor: Immediate doctor consultation is required, as meningitis can be life-threatening.

data.description: Dengue is a mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like illness and, in severe cases, hemorrhagic fever.
data.vaccine: Yes, Dengvaxia vaccine is available in some countries.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if you develop severe abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, or bleeding symptoms.

data.description: Tuberculosis is a bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis that mainly affects the lungs.
prevention: Avoid close contact with TB patients
data.consult_doctor: Doctor consultation is necessary if you have persistent cough for more than 2 weeks with weight loss or fever.

data.description: Migraine is a neurological condition characterized by intense headaches often accompanied by nausea and light sensitivity.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if migraines are frequent, disabling, or associated with vision problems.

data.description: Asthma is a chronic respiratory disease causing inflammation and narrowing of the airways.
data.consult_doctor: Doctor consultation is needed if you experience frequent asthma attacks or severe breathing difficulty.

data.description: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.
medication: Antimalarial drugs such as Chloroquine, Artemisinin-based combination therapy
data.vaccine: Yes, RTS,S malaria vaccine is available.
data.consult_doctor: Immediate medical attention is required if malaria symptoms appear, especially in children and pregnant women.

data.description: Influenza is an acute viral respiratory infection that causes fever, muscle aches, and respiratory symptoms.
prevention: Avoid close contact with sick people
medication: Antiviral drugs if started early (oseltamivir, etc.)
data.vaccine: Yes — annual flu vaccine recommended for most people.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if you have difficulty breathing, chest pain, high fever that doesn't respond to medication, or if you are pregnant or have chronic illness.

data.description: Pneumonia is an infection of the lung tissue caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi, leading to inflammation and impaired breathing.
prevention: Pneumococcal and influenza vaccines where indicated
medication: Antivirals for some viral causes if indicated
data.vaccine: Yes — pneumococcal vaccines and annual flu vaccine reduce risk of some pneumonias.
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor promptly for persistent high fever, rapid breathing, chest pain, or worsening shortness of breath.

data.description: Bronchitis is inflammation of the bronchial tubes, commonly viral and causing cough and mucus production.
prevention: Vaccination against flu and pertussis when appropriate
medication: Rest, fluids, cough suppressants or expectorants
Antibiotics only if bacterial infection suspected
data.vaccine: No specific vaccine for acute bronchitis; flu and pertussis vaccines reduce some causes.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if cough lasts more than 3 weeks, you cough up blood, or experience high fever or difficulty breathing.

data.description: Hepatitis A is an acute, usually self-limited liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus, commonly spread via contaminated food or water.
prevention: Vaccination for at-risk or traveling individuals
medication: No specific antiviral for hepatitis A
data.vaccine: Yes — effective hepatitis A vaccine is available and recommended for at-risk populations.
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if you develop jaundice, persistent vomiting, severe abdominal pain, or confusion.

data.description: Hepatitis C is a viral infection that can cause chronic liver disease and is transmitted mainly via blood contact.
prevention: Avoid sharing needles or personal items with blood exposure
medication: Direct-acting antiviral (DAA) treatments that can cure most infections
data.vaccine: No vaccine currently available for hepatitis C.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor for testing if you have risk factors (blood exposures, transfusions before screening eras) or symptoms of liver disease.

data.description: Gastroenteritis is inflammation of the stomach and intestines usually due to viruses, bacteria, or toxins, causing diarrhea and vomiting.
medication: Antibiotics only if bacterial cause confirmed and indicated
data.vaccine: Rotavirus vaccine available for infants; some travel-related vaccines may apply in specific settings.
data.consult_doctor: Seek medical care for signs of dehydration (reduced urine, dizziness), high fever, bloody stools, or prolonged vomiting.

data.description: UTI is an infection of parts of the urinary system (bladder, urethra, or kidneys) usually caused by bacteria.
medication: Appropriate antibiotics prescribed by a doctor
data.vaccine: No widely used vaccine; research ongoing.
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor for painful urination, fever, flank pain (possible kidney involvement), or if symptoms recur frequently.

data.description: Tonsillitis is inflammation of the tonsils caused by viruses or bacteria, leading to sore throat and swallowing difficulty.
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected people
medication: Antibiotics if bacterial (e.g., streptococcal) infection confirmed
data.vaccine: No specific vaccine for tonsillitis; routine immunizations reduce some causes (e.g., influenza).
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if you have severe throat pain, high fever, drooling, difficulty breathing, or inability to swallow liquids.

symptoms: Small red bumps or burrows on skin
data.description: Scabies is a contagious skin infestation caused by the mite Sarcoptes scabiei, producing intense itching and rash.
prevention: Avoid prolonged skin-to-skin contact with infected persons
Wash bedding and clothing of infected persons
medication: Topical scabicidal creams (permethrin) or oral ivermectin in some cases
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if itching is severe, rash spreads, or symptoms persist after over-the-counter treatment.

data.description: Mumps is a viral infection that commonly causes painful swelling of the parotid salivary glands and sometimes complications like orchitis.
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected individuals
data.vaccine: Yes — MMR vaccine protects against mumps and is routinely given in childhood immunization schedules.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if you have severe swelling, high fever, severe headache, or symptoms suggesting complications (e.g., testicular pain, hearing changes).

data.description: A condition where the body lacks enough iron to produce adequate hemoglobin, causing reduced oxygen delivery to tissues.
prevention: Eat iron-rich foods (red meat, leafy greens, legumes)
medication: Oral iron supplements (ferrous sulfate) under medical guidance
Iron intravenous therapy for severe cases
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if you experience persistent fatigue, shortness of breath on minimal exertion, or signs of bleeding (black stool or heavy menstrual bleeding).

data.description: A group of inherited blood disorders causing reduced hemoglobin production and varying degrees of anemia.
medication: Regular blood transfusions for severe forms
Iron chelation therapy to remove excess iron
data.vaccine: No vaccine; ensure routine vaccines are up to date due to transfusion-related infection risks.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a hematologist if you have persistent anemia, family history of thalassemia, or require frequent transfusions.

data.description: Heart valve damage resulting from rheumatic fever, which follows untreated group A streptococcal throat infection.
prevention: Prompt treatment of strep throat with appropriate antibiotics
Secondary prophylaxis with penicillin in diagnosed cases
medication: Long-term antibiotics for prevention of recurrence; valve surgery in severe cases
data.vaccine: No vaccine against rheumatic fever; research ongoing for group A strep vaccines.
data.consult_doctor: Seek medical care for persistent fever with sore throat, unexplained joint pain, or new breathlessness — early treatment prevents heart damage.

data.description: An interruption of blood flow to part of the brain (ischemic) or bleeding within the brain (hemorrhagic), causing sudden neurological deficits.
prevention: Control blood pressure, diabetes and cholesterol
Anticoagulation for suitable patients with atrial fibrillation
medication: Emergency treatments may include clot-busting drugs (thrombolytics) for eligible ischemic strokes
data.consult_doctor: Call emergency services immediately for sudden face/arm/leg weakness, speech difficulty, or severe sudden headache — every minute matters.

data.description: A progressive neurological disorder caused by loss of dopamine-producing brain cells, leading to movement and non-motor symptoms.
prevention: No proven prevention; healthy lifestyle and early evaluation of symptoms may help management
medication: Dopamine agonists, MAO-B inhibitors, symptomatic therapies
data.consult_doctor: See a neurologist if you experience persistent tremor, slowness, stiffness, or recurrent falls.

data.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder and the most common cause of dementia, affecting memory, thinking, and behavior.
prevention: Healthy diet, regular exercise, mental stimulation, and good cardiovascular risk control may reduce risk
medication: Medications can modestly slow symptoms (cholinesterase inhibitors, memantine)
Supportive care, cognitive therapies, caregiver support
data.vaccine: No approved vaccine currently; research ongoing.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if memory problems interfere with daily life, or if there is rapid decline or behavioral changes.

data.description: A common mental health disorder characterized by persistent sadness and loss of interest that impairs daily functioning.
prevention: Maintain social connections, stress management, healthy sleep, and early treatment of symptoms
data.consult_doctor: See a healthcare professional if depressive symptoms last more than two weeks, or if there are thoughts of self-harm — seek urgent help for suicidal thoughts.

data.description: Anxiety disorders cause excessive fear or worry that interferes with daily life; panic disorder includes sudden intense episodes of fear.
prevention: Stress management techniques, regular exercise, good sleep hygiene
Avoid excessive caffeine and substances that trigger anxiety
medication: Short-term benzodiazepines (careful use), SSRIs/SNRIs for long-term control, psychotherapy (CBT)
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if anxiety is persistent, disabling, or accompanied by panic attacks, suicidal thoughts, or substance use.

data.description: A condition where bones become weak and brittle, increasing the risk of fractures.
prevention: Adequate calcium and vitamin D intake
medication: Bisphosphonates, selective estrogen receptor modulators, parathyroid hormone analogs in specific cases
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor for risk assessment if you have risk factors (postmenopausal women, long-term steroid use) or after any low-trauma fracture.

data.description: Underactive thyroid gland producing insufficient thyroid hormones, causing slowed metabolism and multiple systemic symptoms.
prevention: No direct prevention for autoimmune causes; awareness and screening in at-risk groups (family history, postpartum)
medication: Thyroid hormone replacement (levothyroxine) with dose monitoring
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if you have persistent fatigue, unexplained weight gain, cold intolerance, or swelling of the neck (goiter).

data.description: A chronic condition where the body cannot properly regulate blood glucose levels due to lack of insulin (Type 1) or insulin resistance (Type 2).
prevention: Routine blood sugar checks in high-risk groups
medication: Oral hypoglycemics (metformin, sulfonylureas) or insulin for Type 2
data.consult_doctor: Consult immediately if you experience unexplained weight loss, excessive thirst, or frequent urination. Emergency care is needed for diabetic ketoacidosis (nausea, abdominal pain, fruity-smelling breath).

data.description: A bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, most commonly affecting the lungs but can spread to other organs.
prevention: Good ventilation and mask use in high-risk areas
medication: 6-month course of anti-TB drugs (isoniazid, rifampicin, pyrazinamide, ethambutol) under medical supervision
data.vaccine: BCG vaccine is recommended, especially in countries with high TB prevalence.
data.consult_doctor: Seek medical attention if cough persists for more than 2 weeks, especially with blood-stained sputum, fever, or night sweats.

data.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms, which can progress to severe dengue with bleeding and organ damage.
prevention: Avoid mosquito bites with nets and repellents
medication: No specific antiviral drug; supportive treatment with fluids, rest, and paracetamol (avoid aspirin/NSAIDs)
data.vaccine: Dengvaxia is available in some countries for previously infected individuals.
data.consult_doctor: Seek urgent medical care if you develop bleeding, severe abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, or difficulty breathing.

data.description: A life-threatening mosquito-borne parasitic disease caused by Plasmodium species, transmitted by the bite of female Anopheles mosquitoes.
prevention: Prophylactic antimalarial drugs when traveling to endemic areas
medication: Antimalarial drugs such as artemisinin-based combination therapy (ACT)
Chloroquine or quinine depending on resistance patterns
data.vaccine: RTS,S malaria vaccine is available for children in high-risk regions.
data.consult_doctor: Seek immediate medical attention if fever develops after visiting malaria-endemic areas, especially if accompanied by chills or sweats.

data.description: A viral infection of the liver caused by Hepatitis B virus, transmitted through blood, sexual contact, and mother-to-child transmission.
medication: Antiviral drugs (tenofovir, entecavir) for chronic cases
data.vaccine: Yes, highly effective Hepatitis B vaccine available and part of universal immunization schedules.
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if you notice jaundice, persistent fatigue, or have been exposed to infected blood/fluids.

data.description: A mild viral infection of the upper respiratory tract caused by rhinoviruses and other viruses.
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected individuals
Strengthen immunity with proper rest and nutrition
medication: No cure; symptomatic treatment with rest, hydration, and over-the-counter medicines for congestion/fever
data.consult_doctor: Usually self-limiting; consult a doctor if symptoms last more than 10 days, worsen, or if severe breathing difficulty occurs.

data.description: A bacterial throat infection caused by Group A Streptococcus bacteria.
medication: Antibiotics (penicillin or amoxicillin) prescribed by a doctor
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if sore throat is severe, lasts more than 3 days, or is accompanied by high fever and swollen lymph nodes.

data.description: An infection of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord, caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected individuals
medication: Antivirals for viral meningitis in some cases
data.vaccine: Yes, vaccines against common bacterial causes (Hib, meningococcal, pneumococcal) are available.
data.consult_doctor: Emergency medical attention is required if sudden headache, fever, and neck stiffness occur — meningitis can be life-threatening.

data.description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation and ulcers in the lining of the colon and rectum.
prevention: No specific prevention; healthy diet and stress management may help
medication: Immunosuppressants or biologics in severe cases
data.consult_doctor: Consult a gastroenterologist if persistent bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain, or unexplained weight loss occurs.

data.description: A complication of diabetes that causes nerve damage, particularly in the legs and feet.
prevention: Healthy lifestyle with exercise and proper diet
medication: Antidepressants or anticonvulsants for nerve pain
data.consult_doctor: Seek medical attention if you have diabetes with numbness, pain, or sores on feet that do not heal.

data.description: A chronic inflammatory disease of the airways causing recurrent breathing problems.
data.consult_doctor: Seek immediate care if asthma attacks are frequent, severe, or unresponsive to inhalers.

data.description: An infection of the urinary system, commonly affecting bladder and urethra, caused by bacteria.
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if symptoms persist, worsen, or are accompanied by fever and back pain (possible kidney infection).

data.description: A type of cancer that starts in the lungs, often linked to smoking and environmental factors.
medication: Surgery, chemotherapy, radiotherapy, targeted therapy, immunotherapy (depending on stage)
data.consult_doctor: Seek medical care if chronic cough worsens, especially with blood-stained sputum or unexplained weight loss.

data.description: A life-threatening diabetes complication where the body produces high levels of blood acids (ketones).
prevention: Monitor blood sugar and ketone levels
medication: Hospital treatment with IV fluids, insulin therapy, electrolyte replacement
data.consult_doctor: Emergency medical treatment is required — DKA can be fatal if untreated.

data.description: An infection of the lungs that can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi, leading to inflammation and fluid in the alveoli.
data.vaccine: Yes, pneumococcal and Hib vaccines available.
data.consult_doctor: Seek urgent care if breathing difficulty, chest pain, or high fever occurs.

data.description: A chronic condition where blood pressure remains persistently elevated, increasing risk of heart disease and stroke.
medication: Antihypertensives (ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, diuretics, calcium channel blockers)
data.consult_doctor: Consult if blood pressure is consistently high or if you experience headaches, chest pain, or blurred vision.

data.description: A medical emergency where blood flow to the heart muscle is blocked, causing tissue damage.
prevention: Control blood pressure, cholesterol, and diabetes
medication: Emergency treatment with aspirin, thrombolytics, angioplasty, stenting, or bypass surgery
data.consult_doctor: Call emergency services immediately if chest pain persists beyond a few minutes or radiates to the arm/jaw.

data.description: Inflammation of the appendix, often requiring urgent surgical removal.
prevention: No specific prevention; maintaining high-fiber diet may reduce risk
data.consult_doctor: Seek emergency medical care for sudden severe lower-right abdominal pain with fever.

data.description: A condition where calcium levels in the blood are above normal, often due to overactive parathyroid glands or cancer.
prevention: Avoid excessive vitamin D and calcium supplements
medication: IV fluids, diuretics, bisphosphonates, calcitonin (depending on cause)
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if experiencing confusion, persistent nausea, or kidney stones.

data.description: A type of blood cancer that begins in lymphocytes (white blood cells) and affects the lymphatic system.
prevention: No specific prevention; awareness and early detection improve outcomes
medication: Chemotherapy, radiotherapy, immunotherapy, stem cell transplant (depending on type and stage)
data.consult_doctor: Consult a doctor if persistent lymph node swelling, night sweats, or unexplained fever/weight loss occurs.

data.description: A condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone, speeding up body metabolism.
medication: Radioactive iodine or surgery if needed
data.consult_doctor: Seek medical attention if persistent palpitations, weight loss, or unexplained anxiety occur.

data.description: A viral infection usually caused by Epstein-Barr Virus (EBV), spread through saliva.
medication: No specific treatment; supportive care with rest, fluids, and pain relievers
data.consult_doctor: Consult if severe fatigue persists, or if there is abdominal pain suggesting an enlarged spleen.

data.description: A mental health condition marked by extreme mood swings including emotional highs (mania) and lows (depression).
data.consult_doctor: Seek psychiatric evaluation if experiencing prolonged depression or episodes of mania with risky behaviors.

data.description: An autoimmune disease causing chronic inflammation of joints, leading to pain and deformity.
medication: NSAIDs and corticosteroids for symptom relief
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if persistent joint pain and stiffness occur, especially in the morning.

data.description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting the digestive tract, leading to severe digestive symptoms.
prevention: No specific prevention; avoid smoking and manage stress
data.consult_doctor: Consult a gastroenterologist for persistent abdominal pain, blood in stool, or unexplained weight loss.

data.description: Non-cancerous enlargement of the prostate gland, common in older men, causing urinary problems.
data.consult_doctor: See a urologist if urination difficulties affect daily life or are associated with pain/blood in urine.

data.description: A chronic autoimmune skin condition causing rapid skin cell buildup, leading to scaling and inflammation.
prevention: Avoid triggers like stress, smoking, infections
data.consult_doctor: Consult if skin lesions are widespread, painful, or associated with joint pain.

data.description: A condition caused by Vitamin D, calcium, or phosphate deficiency leading to soft, weak bones.
prevention: Balanced diet with Vitamin D and calcium
data.consult_doctor: Consult if child has delayed growth, bone deformities, or if adults have bone pain and weakness.

data.description: A rare condition where kidneys cannot conserve water, leading to excessive urination and thirst.
prevention: No known prevention; genetic counseling in hereditary cases
data.consult_doctor: See a doctor if urine output is abnormally high and persistent despite adequate hydration.

data.description: A neurological disorder where abnormal brain activity causes recurrent seizures.
data.consult_doctor: Seek medical help if seizures occur repeatedly, last more than 5 minutes, or cause injury/unconsciousness.

options.title: Want to Know about Vaccination
options.description: Get details about vaccines available for different diseases.

data.name: Vaccination Schedule
data.description: Recommended vaccination schedule for different age groups.

vaccines.name: Pneumococcal (PPSV23/PCV13)
vaccines.dose: Single or series, esp. if chronic illness
